activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul D. Barrows

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on March 7, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

03:05 PM  Defendant Paul D. Barrows appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Taylor E Klokow appeared by video for Paul D. Barrows.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.

3:44 PM Defendant Paul D. Barrows appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz appeared by video for Paul D. Barrows.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant needs to contact public defenders office.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:36 PM Defendant Paul D. Barrows appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for Paul D. Barrows.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $650 set with conditions of no violent or disorderly conduct with victims: SDB, RAS and TB. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  Absolute sobriety. Take all medication as prescribed. Follow through with all counseling. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:00am.

No violent or disorderly conduct with victims: SDB, RAS and TB. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  Absolute sobriety. Take all medication as prescribed. Follow through with all counseling.
